wikipedia_page.main: Alexander Mitchell Duncan CMG (25 September 1888–1 September 1965) was a Scottish-Australian police officer. Duncan was Chief Commissioner of Victoria Police from 1937 to 1954.

response: *Alexander Duncan (army officer) (1780–1859), East India Company officer
*Alexander Duncan (bishop) (1655–1733), Scottish Episcopal clergyman and bishop
*Alexander Duncan (police officer) (1888–1965), Scottish police officer and Chief Commissioner of Victoria Police (Australia), 1937–1954
*Alexander Duncan (doctor), British doctor who spent six years in a village high up in the Wakhan Corridor of north-eastern Afghanistan

He was St Kilda's club captain in 1936;Holmesby & Main (2007). however, as a policeman, he was forced to retire after three VFL seasons, following a declaration by the new Police Commissioner, Alexander Duncan, that members of the Victorian police force could not play professional football.The Argus, "Policemen May Not Play Professional Football", 30 March 1937, p. 11.Barclay, Bert, "Perkins Retires from Football", The Herald, (Monday, 29 March 1937), p.16.
